column4: in top, does the RSS (resident share) include the SHR mem size, or do I add the two together to determine the actual footprint of the process?
actual footprint is a bit tricky
best way is to kill the process, see what "free" says, then run the process and see what "free" says
yes, you're right.  I've got to measure the impact of using Java vs. Perl as an interpreter.  BeanShell is my friend ;)
